00026 struct BufferData;
00027 class Buffer;
00028 class FloatBuffer;
00029 class Int24Buffer;
00030 class Int16Buffer;
00031 
00032 /// A reference-counted array of samples with useful methods and operator overloading.
00033 
00034 /// A "smart" array of samples with reference-counting, lots of useful
00035 /// methods, and operator overloading.
00036 ///
00037 /// There is an inheritance hierarchy, where "Buffer" is the parent and
00038 /// FloatBuffer, Int24Buffer, and Int16Buffer are the children.  The
00039 /// design is unusual, though; the parent class contains all the data
00040 /// and all of the methods whose functions signatures do not expose
00041 /// the type of the buffer.  The subclasses contain no extra data,
00042 /// only methods that cannot go in the base class.
00043 
00044 class Buffer {
00045  public:
00046 
00047    Buffer();
00048 
00049    /// How the Buffer class should dispose of memory supplied to it in the constructor.
00050    typedef enum {
00051       DontDispose,        ///< Take no action to free the memory
00052       MakeCopy,           ///< Copy the supplied buffer, and delete it when finished
00053       DisposeWithFree,    ///< Delete the buffer with the C call free() when finished
00054       DisposeWithDelete   ///< Delete the buffer with the C++ operator delete when finished
00055    } disposalMethod;
00056 
00057    /// The format of samples contained in this buffer
00058    typedef enum {
00059       FloatSample,     ///< 32-bit IEEE floating-point numbers
00060       Int24Sample,     ///< 24-bit ints packed in the low 3 bits of a 32-bit int
00061       Int16Sample      ///< 16-bit signed integers
00062    } sampleFormat;
00063 
00064 
00065    // Destructor
00066    ~Buffer();
00067 
00068    /// Create a new buffer of the specified type and length
00069    Buffer(sampleFormat format, int len);
00070 
00071    /// Create a copy of the given buffer.
00072    Buffer(const Buffer &src);
00073 
00074    /// Set the value of this buffer equal to that of another buffer.
00075    Buffer& operator=(const Buffer& src);
00076 
00077 
00078    /// Construct a new buffer by appending two existing buffers together.
00079    static Buffer Append(const Buffer& left,
00080                         const Buffer& right);
00081 
00082    /// Construct a new buffer by appending three existing buffers together.
00083    static Buffer Append(const Buffer& left,
00084                         const Buffer& middle,
00085                         const Buffer& right);
00086 
00087    /// Query the length of this buffer in samples.
00088    int GetLength() const;
00089 
00090    /// Query the bytes per sample when stored in memory
00091    int GetBytesPerSample() const;
00092 
00093    /// Query the bytes per sample when packed on disk
00094    int GetPackedBytesPerSample() const;
00095 
00096    /// Get a packed representation of this buffer suitable for storing on disk.
00097    void GetPackedData(char *outDataPtr, int start = 0);
00098 
00099    /// Get a packed representation of this buffer suitable for storing on disk.
00100    void GetPackedData(char *outDataPtr, int start, int len);
00101 
00102    /// Change the size of the buffer.  The data is not preserved.
00103    void Resize(int newSize);
00104 
00105    /// Get the type of samples held in the buffer.
00106    sampleFormat GetSampleFormat();
00107 
00108    /// Get a subset of the buffer
00109    Buffer Get(int start) const;
00110 
00111    /// Get a subset of the buffer.
00112    Buffer Get(int start, int len, int stride = 1) const;
00113 
00114    /// Set samples in this buffer to be equal to the given buffer.
00115    void Set(int start, Buffer buffer);
00116 
00117    /// Multiply all values in this buffer by the given factor.
00118    void operator*=(float factor);
00119 
00120    /// Get this buffer as a FloatBuffer, converting if necessary
00121    FloatBuffer AsFloat() const;
00122 
00123    /// Get this buffer as an Int24Buffer, converting if necessary
00124    Int24Buffer AsInt24(bool dither = false) const;
00125 
00126    /// Get this buffer as an Int16Buffer, converting if necessary
00127    Int16Buffer AsInt16(bool dither = false) const;
00128 
00129    /// Mix another buffer with this buffer.
00130    void operator+=(const Buffer &right);
00131 
00132    // Multiplying element-wise
00133    void operator*=(const Buffer &right);
00134 
00135  protected:
00136 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
00137    BufferData *mData;
00138 
00139    void Detach();
00140    void CopyOnWrite();
00141 
00142    // without these, copy constructors of the form:
00143    //    FloatBuffer(const Buffer& src)
00144    // aren't given access to protected members of src.  Weird.
00145    friend class FloatBuffer;
00146    friend class Int24Buffer;
00147    friend class Int16Buffer;
00148 #endif
00149 };
00150 
00151 #define COMMON_DERIVED_CLASS_METHODS(CLASSNAME, TYPENAME)                    \
00152  private:                                                                    \
00153    CLASSNAME ## Buffer(BufferData* data) { mData = data; }                   \
00154                                                                              \
00155  public:                                                                     \
00156    /* Construct with zeros */                                                \
00157    CLASSNAME ## Buffer(int len, TYPENAME initialValues=0);                   \
00158                                                                              \
00159    /* Create a new buffer of the same type as this one */                    \
00160    Buffer NewBufferWithSameType(int len);                                    \
00161                                                                              \
00162    /* Construct with existing data */                                        \
00163    CLASSNAME ## Buffer(TYPENAME *buffer, int start, int len, int stride=1,   \
00164                        disposalMethod method=MakeCopy);                      \
00165                                                                              \
00166    /* Copy constructor. Only adds references to existing data */             \
00167    CLASSNAME ## Buffer(const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &src);                      \
00168                                                                              \
00169    /* Construct by appending two or three existing buffers together */       \
00170    CLASSNAME ## Buffer(const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &left,                      \
00171                        const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &right);                    \
00172                                                                              \
00173    CLASSNAME ## Buffer(const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &left,                      \
00174                        const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &middle,                    \
00175                        const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &right);                    \
00176                                                                              \
00177    /* Assignment operator  */                                                \
00178    CLASSNAME ## Buffer& operator=(const CLASSNAME ## Buffer &src);           \
00179                                                                              \
00180    /* Destructor */                                                          \
00181    ~CLASSNAME ## Buffer();                                                   \
00182                                                                              \
00183    /* Getting samples */                                                     \
00184    void Get(TYPENAME *buffer, int start) const;                              \
00185    void Get(TYPENAME *buffer, int start, int len, int stride=1) const;       \
00186    TYPENAME *GetPtr(int start = 0) const;                                    \
00187                                                                              \
00188    /* Setting samples */                                                     \
00189    void Set(TYPENAME *buffer, int start, int len, int stride=1);             \
00190                                                                              \
00191    /* Query summary statistics */                                            \
00192    TYPENAME GetMin() const;                                                  \
00193    TYPENAME GetMax() const;                                                  \
00194    TYPENAME GetAbsMax() const;                                               \
00195                                                                              \
00196    /* Subsetting */                                                          \
00197    CLASSNAME ## Buffer Get(int start) const;                                 \
00198    /* Subsetting */                                                          \
00199    CLASSNAME ## Buffer Get(int start, int len, int stride=1) const;          \
00200                                                                              \
00201    void Set(int start, CLASSNAME ## Buffer buffer);                          \
00202                                                                              \
00203    /* Adding or multiplying by scalars */                                    \
00204    void operator+=(TYPENAME offset);                                         \
00205                                                                              \
00206    /* Array-like interface */                                                \
00207    TYPENAME operator[](int index) const;                                     \
00208    TYPENAME& operator[](int index);                                          \
00209                                                                              \
00210    friend class Buffer;
00211 
00212 
00213 class FloatBuffer : public Buffer
00214 {
00215    COMMON_DERIVED_CLASS_METHODS(Float, float)
00216 
00217    // Vector math operations - return buffers of the same type
00218    FloatBuffer Ln() const;
00219    FloatBuffer Log10() const;
00220    FloatBuffer ToDB() const;
00221    FloatBuffer Exp() const;
00222    FloatBuffer Pow(float exponent) const;
00223    FloatBuffer FromDB() const;
00224    FloatBuffer Sqr() const;  // Square
00225    FloatBuffer Sqrt() const; // Square root
00226 
00227    // In-place vector math operations.
00228    void ApplyLn() const;
00229    void ApplyLog10() const;
00230    void ApplyToDB() const;
00231    void ApplyExp() const;
00232    void ApplyPow(float exponent) const;
00233    void ApplyFromDB() const;
00234    void ApplySqr() const;  // Square
00235    void ApplySqrt() const; // Square root
00236 
00237    /* Synonym for Interpolate; allows you to query values between samples */
00238    float operator[](float x) const;
00239 
00240    /* Returns interpolated x-position of peak */
00241    float GetPeak() const;
00242    float GetPeak(int start, int stop) const;
00243 
00244    float GetRMS() const; /* Root-Mean-Squared */
00245    float GetMean() const;
00246    float GetSum() const;    /* get a sum of the samples */
00247    float GetSumSq() const;  /* get the sum of squaring every sample */
00248 
00249    /* Interpolating values between samples */
00250    float Interpolate(float x) const;
00251 
00252 };
00253 
00254 class Int24Buffer : public Buffer
00255 {
00256    COMMON_DERIVED_CLASS_METHODS(Int24, posh_i32_t)
00257 };
00258 
00259 class Int16Buffer : public Buffer
00260 {
00261    COMMON_DERIVED_CLASS_METHODS(Int16, posh_i16_t)
00262 };
00263 
00264 inline std::string SampleFormatToStr(Buffer::sampleFormat type)
00265 {
00266    switch(type)
00267    {
00268       case Buffer::FloatSample:
00269          return std::string("float");
00270 
00271       case Buffer::Int24Sample:
00272          return std::string("int24");
00273 
00274       case Buffer::Int16Sample:
00275          return std::string("int16");
00276 
00277       default:
00278          InternalAssert(false, "Unknown sample format");
00279          return std::string("");
00280    }
00281 }
00282 
00283 inline Buffer::sampleFormat StrToSampleFormat(std::string str)
00284 {
00285    if(str == "float")
00286       return Buffer::FloatSample;
00287    else if(str == "int24")
00288       return Buffer::Int24Sample;
00289    else if(str == "int16")
00290       return Buffer::Int16Sample;
00291    else
00292    {
00293       InternalAssert(false, "Unknown sample format");
00294       return Buffer::FloatSample;   // shut the compiler up
00295    }
00296 }
